title: 111_hr1992
content: The "Immigration Fraud Prevention Act of 2009" is also known as the Act. It aims to prevent fraud schemes targeting aliens. The "Immigration Fraud Prevention Act of 2009" introduces new amendments to Title 18, United States Code, specifically targeting schemes to defraud aliens. It includes penalties for individuals who engage in fraudulent activities related to Federal immigration laws, such as misrepresentation or obtaining money through false pretenses. Individuals who falsely claim to be attorneys or accredited representatives in Federal immigration matters face fines, imprisonment up to 5 years, or both under the Immigration Fraud Prevention Act of 2009. The Attorney General and the Secretary of Homeland Security will investigate schemes to defraud aliens under section 1041 of title 18, United States Code. The Executive Office of Immigration Review will be used for detection and investigation. The Attorney General and the Secretary of Homeland Security will investigate schemes to defraud aliens under section 1041 of title 18, United States Code using the Executive Office of Immigration Review for detection and investigation. Amendments to the Immigration and Nationality Act include providing aliens with the right to counsel and a list of authorized representatives. The Attorney General will maintain lists of disciplined practitioners in immigration proceedings, provide materials in appropriate languages, and ensure oral notification by immigration judges to aliens. The Attorney General will conduct outreach to immigrant communities to educate aliens on legal services to prevent fraud by unauthorized individuals. The Attorney General and the Secretary of Homeland Security will provide information on fraud by unauthorized immigration consultants to aliens through offices and websites. Foreign language materials will be available to immigrant communities for educational purposes. Foreign language materials, including English and Spanish, will be provided to immigrant communities for educational purposes.
